question:

solution:
(b)
Logic :- (1stno.6) = (2nd no.)
(96 , 16) :- (966) = 16
(156 ,26) :- (1566) = 26
Similarly,
(228 , ?) :- (2286) = 38

question: Which country partnered with India to co-design and co-produce electric propulsion systems for future warships in November 2024 ?
solution: (b) United Kingdom. Signed in Portsmouth during the third joint working group meeting on electric propulsion capability partnership, this initiative underscores the commitment to indigenous development of advanced naval technologies.

question: The north-west region of India receives rainfall in winter due to :
solution: (a) Western disturbances are weather phenomena that occur during the winter months, brought in by westerly winds from the Mediterranean region. These disturbances typically affect the north and north-western parts of India. Though the amount of winter rainfall, locally known as ‘mahawat,’ is small, it plays a crucial role in the cultivation of rabi crops.

question: Constitutions limit the power of government in many ways. The most common way of limiting the power of government is to specify certain __________ that all of us possess as citizens and which no government can ever be allowed to violate.
solution: (a) Fundamental Rights. The Fundamental Rights are enshrined in Part III (Magna Carta of India) of the Constitution (Articles 12-35). The Constitution of India provides for six Fundamental Rights: Right to equality (Articles 14–18), Right to freedom (Articles 19–22), Right against exploitation (Articles 23–24), Right to freedom of religion (Articles 25–28), Cultural and educational rights (Articles 29–30), and Right to constitutional remedies (Article 32).

question: The Ghode Modni dance, to celebrate the victory of warriors, is performed in which of the following states of India?
solution: (a) Goa. Dances of Indian States: Goa - Dashavatara, Dekhni, Dhalo, Dhangar, Fugdi, Goff, Kunbi. West Bengal - Gaudiya Nritya, Rabindra Nritya, Dhali and Raibenshe. Karnataka - Yakshagana, Kunitha, Veeragase, Bolak-aat, Ummatt-aat and Bayalata. Tamil Nadu - Karakattam, Kummi, Mayil Aattam, Kolattam, Poikkal Kudirai Aattam, Theru Koothu and Villu Pattu.

question: Which Commission drew the boundary line between India and Pakistan?
solution: (a) Radcliffe Boundary Commission. The "Radcliffe Line" became the border between India and Pakistan the partition of India on 17 August 1947. The Border Commission headed by Sir Cyril Radcliffe. Gandhi-Irwin Pact (1931 - 32) was an agreement between Mahatma Gandhi and Lord Irwin. The Hilton Young Commission (1926) recommended the establishment of the 'Reserve Bank of India'. The Bretton Woods Committee (BWC in 1944) created two organizations - the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank.

question: Which of the following festivals is celebrated by the Jain community in Pawapuri, Bihar to commemorate the attainment of Nirvana by Lord Mahavira?
solution: (b) Dev Diwali. Jain Festivals: Paryushan parva - A jain festival of reflection and seeking forgiveness for one's sins. Jnan Panchami - The holy day for acquiring knowledge. Maun Ekadashi - The holy day for observing silence. Paush dashami - This day is famous as the birthday of Bhagwan Parshwanath.

question: Articles 214 to 231 in Part VI of the Indian Constitution deal with the __________.
solution: (a) High Courts. Articles 214 to 231 in Part VI of the Constitution deal with the organization, independence, jurisdiction, powers, and procedures of the high courts. Article 214 : Establishes that there shall be a High Court for each State. Articles 226 : Power of High Courts to issue certain writs. Articles 227 : Power of superintendence over all courts by the High Court. Articles 229 : Officers and servants and the expenses of High Courts. Articles 230 : Extension of jurisdiction of High Courts to Union territories.

question: Who won the Best FIFA Men's Player award in 2024?
solution: (c) Vinícius Júnior. Vinícius Júnior was playing for Real Madrid when he received the award.

question: Which Indian musician is the first singer to get the highest civilian honour, the Bharat Ratna?
solution: (c) M.S. Subbulakshmi. Her awards: Bharat Ratna (1998), Padma Vibhushan (1975), Padma Bhushan (1954), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for Carnatic Music - Vocal (1956). Bharat Ratna Award was instituted in 1954.

question: Which Indian personality is known as the Mozart of Madras?
solution: (c) A.R Rahman. He got this nickname from Time Magazine. Awards: Padma Shri (2000), Padma Bhushan (2010), Six National Film Awards, Two Grammy Awards, A Golden Globe Award and fifteen Filmfare Awards. Other musicians and their nicknames : Lata Mangeshkar - “Queen of melody”. Kishore Kumar - “Kishore Da”. Usha Uthup - “The Queen of Indipop”.

question: Khudai Khidmatgar, a voluntary organisation, was established by which of the following leaders of India?
solution: (b) Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan, also known as Badshah Khan or "Frontier Gandhi," founded the Khudai Khidmatgar ("Servants of God") movement in 1929. This group of Pashtuns used non-violent methods to fight against British rule. Maulana Muhammad Ali was a prominent Indian Muslim leader, journalist, and scholar who played a key role in the Khilafat movement. Muhammad Ali Jinnah was the leader of the All-India Muslim League and later became the Governor-General of Pakistan. He is honored with the title 'Quaid-i-Azam.'

question: Who has been appointed as the first woman Chairperson of the Railway Board ?
solution: (c) Jaya Verma Sinha : Her previous work experience includes a four-year tenure as Railway Advisor in the Indian High Commission in Dhaka, Bangladesh.

question: Who was the chairman of the drafting committee of the Constituent Assembly of India?
solution: (a) Bhimrao Ambedkar. Major Committees and their Chairman :- Union Power Committee, Union Constituent Committee, State Committee - Jawaharlal Nehru; Rule of Procedure Committee, Steering Committee - Dr Rajendra Prasad; Provincial Constitution Committee, Advisory Committee on Fundamental Rights, Minorities, Tribal and Excluded area - Sardar Patel was the head of this committee.

question: The red colour of tomatoes is due to the presence of:
solution: (b) lycopene. The red color in tomatoes, chillies, and carrots is due to lycopene, a carotenoid pigment. Lycopene helps plants withstand sunlight stress and offers health benefits like supporting heart health and reducing cancer risks. Its concentration varies with environmental factors and plant conditions.

question: In which year did the father of the Green Revolution in India die ?
solution: (c) 2023. MS Swaminathan was born in 1925 in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu. He was instrumental in his pivotal role in the Green Revolution in India during the 1960s and 1970s. In 1987, he was awarded the World Food Prize. Other awards: Padma Shri in 1967, Padma Bhushan in 1972, Padma Vibhushan in 1989 and Bharat Ratna in 2024.

question: As of FY 2024-25, how many total enrollments has the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) achieved?
solution: (c) 7 crore. The Atal Pension Yojana (APY), launched in 2015 to provide a universal social security system for underprivileged and unorganized sector workers, has surpassed 7 crore enrollments as of FY 2024-25, with over 56 lakh new enrollments added in the current financial year.

question: In Volleyball, if the game is tied at ______ in any set (except fifth set), the set continues till one team builds a two-point lead over the other.
solution: (a) 24-24. A set (except the deciding 5th set) is won by the team which first scores 25 points with a minimum lead of two points. In the case of a 24-24 tie, play is continued until a two point lead is achieved (26-24; 27-25; etc.).

question: 'Au' is the symbol for which of the following elements?
solution: (a) Gold. It is derived from the Latin word "Aurum." Aluminium : Symbol is Al (from Latin "Alumen"). Silver: Symbol is Ag (from Latin "Argentum"). Argon: Symbol is Ar.

question: Who among the following rulers introduced the ‘jharokha darshan’ in the Mughal dynasty?
solution: (a) Akbar (1556-1605). Jharokha Darshan was a practice in which Mughal emperors would address the public from the balcony of their forts and palaces. This practice was abolished by Aurangzeb (1658 to 1707) as he considered it a non-Islamic practice. Humayun (1530-1540 and 1555-1556) was the second Mughal Empire. The Shahjahan era marked a time of unparalleled architectural brilliance but also internal discord, culminating in the tragic War of Succession.

question: According to the 2011 Census of India, at all India levels, the adult (15+ years) literacy rate is ____________.
solution: (c) 69.3 percent. According to Census 2011 : The literacy rate at all India levels is 74.04% and the literacy rate for females and males is 65.46% and 82.14% respectively. The top 5 states with the highest literacy rates are Kerala followed by Lakshadweep, Mizoram, Goa, Tripura, and Himachal Pradesh. The bottom 5 states with lowest literacy rates are Bihar followed by Arunachal Pradesh, Rajasthan, Jharkhand and Andhra Pradesh.

question: Pradhan Mantri Virasat Ka Samvardhan (PM VIKAS) Scheme is a scheme of which Ministry of the Government of India?
solution: (c) Ministry of Minority Affairs. Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Ko Kaam Karyakram (PMKKK) renamed as Pradhan Mantri Virasat Ka Samvardhan (PM VIKAS) Scheme. This integrated scheme converges five erstwhile schemes of the Ministry viz. Seekho aur Kamao, USTTAD, Hamari Dharohar, Nai Roshni and Nai Manzil. PM VIKAS, is a skilling initiative focussing on the skilling, entrepreneurship and leadership training requirements of the minority and artisan communities across the country.

question: Who founded the International Olympic Committee (IOC) in 1894?
solution: (b) Baron Pierre de Coubertin. The first modern Olympics took place in Athens, Greece, during the 1896 Summer Olympics. The Olympic flag features a white background with five interlaced rings in the center : Blue, Yellow, Black, Green, and Red. Each color represents a continent: Blue for Europe, Yellow for Asia, Black for Africa, Green for Australia and Oceania, and Red for the Americas. The Olympic motto, "Citius, Altius, Fortius- Communiter" ("Faster, Higher, Stronger- Together"), while the original motto was first expressed by Dominican priest Henri Didon at a school sports event in 1891.

question: Which of the following statements is NOT correct?
option_1: Light year is the unit of distance.
option_2: Light year is the distance travelled by light in one year.
option_3: Light year is the unit of time.
solution: (c) A light year is the distance light travels in one year and serves as a convenient unit for measuring large astronomical distances, approximately 9 trillion kilometers (9 × 10¹² km). A parsec (parallactic second) is the largest practical distance unit in astronomy, defined as the distance at which an arc of 1 astronomical unit subtends an angle of 1 second of arc, equating to 3.08 × 10¹⁶ meters. An astronomical unit (AU) is the mean distance from the Earth to the Sun, used to measure distances to planets, and is equal to 1.496 × 10¹¹ meters.

question: In which state, Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant is established?
solution: (c) Tamil Nadu. Other Nuclear power plants: Tarapur Atomic Power Station (Maharashtra), Rawatbhata Atomic Power Station (Rajasthan), Kaiga Atomic Power Station (Karnataka), Madras Atomic Power Station (Tamil Nadu) Chennai, Kakrapar Atomic Power Station (Gujarat), Narora Atomic Power Station (Uttar Pradesh).

question: NDP = _________.
solution: (a) GDP – Depreciation. Net Domestic Product (NDP) - Aggregate value of goods and services produced within the domestic territory of a country which does not include the depreciation of capital stock. Net Domestic Product at Market Prices (NDPMP) - This measure allows policy-makers to estimate how much the country has to spend just to maintain their current GDP. NDP at Factor Cost (NDPFC) - NDP at factor cost is the income earned by the factors in the form of wages, profits, rent, interest, etc., within the domestic territory of a country. NDPFC = NDPMP - Net ProductTaxes - Net ProductionTaxes.

question: The ratio of the speeds of a boat while going upstream and going downstream is 2 : 3 and the sum of these two speeds is 15 km/h. What is the speed of the stream?
solution:
(b)
Let Speed of upstream and downstream be 2x and 3x respectively,
According to the question,
(2x + 3x) = 15
5x = 15
⇒ x = 3 km/h
Then, speed of upstream and downstream be 6km/h and 9 km/h respectively,
Now, speed of current = 9 - 62 = 32 = 1.5 km/h

(c)
SI = p × r × t100
amount = p + P × 5 × 4100
2400 × 100 = 100p + 20p
120p = 240000
(present worth) p = ₹ 2000

question: Find the average of natural numbers from 1 to 69. (both included)
solution:
(b)
Average of n natural number = (n + 1)2
= (69 + 1)2
= 702
= 35

question: If from each of the three boxes containing 3 white and 1 black, 2 white and 2 black, 1 white and 3 black balls, one ball is drawn at random, then the probability that 2 white and 1 black ball will be drawn is :-
solution:
(a)
Box A : Box B : Box C
White → 3 : 2 : 1
Black → 1 : 2 : 3
Now, one ball is taken randomly :-
Possible case for 2 white and 1 black will be taken:-
Box A : Box B : BoxC
Case 1 = Black 14 : white 24 : white 14
Case 2 = white 34 : Black 24 : white 14
Case 3 = white 34 : white 24 : Black 34
Required possibility :-
14 × 24 × 14 + 34 × 24 × 14 + 34 × 24 × 34
= 264 + 664 + 1864 = 1332

question:
Study the given table and answer the question that follows.
The following table shows the production of printers by four plants of a company over the five years.

What is the difference between the average production of plant 1 and plant 2 during five years?


data:image/png;base64,
solution:
(a) Average production of plant 1 of 5 years
= 35+43+48+32+425 = 2005 = 40
Average production of plant 2 of 5 years
= 25+44+39+40+445 = 1925 = 38.4
Required difference = 40 - 38.4
= 1.6 × 1000 = 1600

question: During the first year the population of a village increased by 5% and during the second year it diminished by 5%. At the end of the second year its population was 47,880. What was the population at the beginning of the first year?
solution:
(c)
Let Population at the beginning of the first year be x
According to the question,
= x × 2120 × 1920 = 47880
= x = 47880 × 2021 × 2019 = 48000

question: A policeman starts chasing a thief who is 500 m ahead of him. The speed of the thief is 18 km/h, and the speed of the policeman is 36 km/h. Find the time taken by the policeman to catch the thief.
solution:
(d)
Relative speed = 36 - 18 = 18 km/h
⇒ 18 km/h = 18 × 518 = 5 m/sec
Time taken to catch the thief = 5005 = 100 sec

question: Simple interest and compound interest on a principal at a certain rate of interest for 2 years is Rs. 12800 and Rs. 14400 respectively. What is the principal ?
solution:
(a)
ATQ, We have following diagram ;

(CI - SI) for 2 yrs = 14400 - 12800 = ₹1600
SI for 1 yr = 128002 = 6400
rate% = 16006400 × 100 = 25%
Principal amount = 6400 × 10025 = ₹25600

question: A cylinder has a curved surface area equal to 350% of the curved surface area of another cylinder. If their radii are in the ratio 3 : 1, then the volume of the smaller cylinder is approximately _____% of the larger cylinder (the smaller cylinder has its radius and height smaller when compared to the larger).
solution:
(d)
According to the question,
CSA of the cylinder = 2πrh
2πrh × 350100 = 2πRH
h : H = 6 : 7 (where radii ratio are, 3 : 1)
Volume of the cylinder = πr2h
Small cylinder volume = π(1)2 × 6
Big cylinder volume = π(3)2 × 7
required% = π12×6 π32×7 × 100 = 9.52%

question: The number nearest to 7658 and exactly divisible by 45 is :
solution:
(d)
765845 = 8 (remainder)
So the nearest number of 7658 which is exactly divisible by 8 will be 7658 - 8 = 7650

solution:
(c)
CPMP = 100-D%100+Profit%
CPMP = 90110
CP : MP = 9 : 11
Required value = 119 = 1.22 times

question: The length (in cm) of a direct common tangent to two circles of radii 14 cm and 5 cm whose centres are separated by a distance of 40 cm is:
solution:
(d)

Length of direct common tangent (LM)
= (40)2-(14-5)2
= 1600-(81)
= 1519 cm

question: Find the remainder, when we divide 2x3 - 3x2 + 6x - 4 by 2x - 3.
solution:
(c)
2x - 3 = 0
x = 32
Putting the value of x in 2x3 - 3x2 + 6x - 4
⇒ 2(32)3 - 3(32)2 + 6 × 32 - 4
⇒ 2 × 278 - 3 × 94 + 6 × 32 - 4
⇒ 274 - 274 + 9 - 4 = 5

question: The ratio between the monthly incomes of P and Q is 7 : 6 and the ratio between their expenditures is 6 : 5. If they save ₹480 each, then find P’s monthly income.
solution:
(d)
Ratio → P : Q
Income → 7 : 6
Expend. → 6 : 5
—-------------------------------
Saving → 1 : 1
Saving (1 unit) = ₹ 480
P’s monthly Income (7 unit) = 7 × 480 = ₹ 3,360

question: In a mixture of 110 litre the ratio of water and milk is 4 : 7 respectively. How much water must be added to make the ratio of water and milk as 8 : 7 respectively ?
solution:
(c)
Ratio - Water Milk
Old - 4 : 7
New - 8 : 7
According to the question,
4 + 7 = 11 unit = 110 litres
Then, 8 - 4 = 4 unit = 11011× 4 = 40 litres

question: Fifteen persons working 12 hours a day earn ₹18,000 per week. How many rupees will 18 persons working 9 hours a day earn per week?
solution:
(b)
Let required rupee = Rs. x
According to the question,
15×1218000 = 18×9x
x = ₹16,200

question: Simplify 20 ÷ 5 of 4 × 8 + 6 ÷ 24 of 3 × 48 - 6 ÷ 18 × 9.
solution:
(a)
20 ÷ 5 of 4 × 8 + 6 ÷ 24 of 3 × 48 - 6 ÷ 18 × 9
20 ÷ 20 × 8 + 6 ÷ 72 × 48 - 13 × 9
1 × 8 + 112 × 48 - 13 × 9
8 + 4 - 3 = 9

question: If m + 5 = sec2Acosec2A(1 - cos2A) (1 - sin2A) + 5, then find the value of m:
solution:
(c)
⇒ m + 5 = sec2Acosec2A(1 - cos2A) (1 - sin2A) + 5
⇒ m + 5 = sec2A.cosec2A .sin2A.cos2A + 5
⇒ m + 5 = 1cos2A.1sin2A .sin2A.cos2A + 5
⇒ m = 1

question: A covered wooden box has the inner measures as 128 cm, 90 cm, 25 cm and the thickness of wood is 5.5 cm. Find the volume of the wood.
solution:
(d)
Dimension of inner part of wooden box = 128 × 90 × 25
Volume of inner part = 128 × 90 × 25 = 288000 cm3
Dimension of outer part of wooden box = (128 + 11) × (90 + 11) × (25 + 11)
Volume of outer part of wooden box = 139 × 101 × 36 = 505404 cm3
Volume of wood = volume of outer part - volume of inner part
= 505404 - 288000 = 217404 cm3

question: To reach at a destination, D takes 45 minutes if he drives at a speed of 60 km/h. Due to some urgency, he is to reach the destination in 30 minutes. What should be his speed in km/h?
solution:
(a)
Distance = speed × time
Distance = 60 × 4560 = 45 km
Required speed = 45×6030 = 90 km/h

question:
Kamlesh offers the following two discount schemes to his customers on the sale of an article:
(i) Two successive discounts of 25% and 5%
(ii) Two successive discounts of 20% and 10%
What is the difference between the selling price (in ₹) of the article under these two discount schemes if its marked price is ₹1,000?
solution:
(b)
(i) SP = 1000 × 34 × 1920 = 712.5
(ii) SP = 1000 × 45 × 910 = 720
Difference between SP = 720 - 712.5 = 7.5

question:
Given below is the observed data of the ages of various children.

What is the mean of the ages of the children?


data:image/png;base64,
solution:
(c)
Sum of age of children
= (6 × 8) + (7 × 3) + (8 × 7) + (9 × 2) + (10 × 20)
= 48 + 21 + 56 + 18 + 200
= 343
Required mean = 3438 + 3 + 7 + 2 + 20
= 34340 = 8.575 year

question: Find the area of the quadrilateral ABCD, the coordinates of whose vertices are A(6, - 3), B(-4, - 2), C(3, 1) and D(5, 0)?
solution:
(a)
Area of quadrilateral = 12|[(x1y2 + x2y3 + x3y4 + x4y1) - (y1x2 + y2x3 + y3x4 + y4x1]|
Given, A(x1y1) = (6, - 3) , B (x2,y2) = (- 4, - 2) , C (x3,y3) = (3, 1) and D(x4,y4) =(5, 0)
Area of quadrilateral
= 12 × [{6 × (- 2) + (-4) × 1 + 3 × 0 + 5 × (- 3)} - {(-3) × (- 4) + (-2) × 3 + 1 × 5 + 0 × 6} ]
= 12 × [{ - 12 - 4 + 0 - 15} - {12 - 6 + 5 + 0}]
= 12 × [{ - 31} - {11}]
= 12 × [{ - 31} - {11}]
= 12 × |- 42|
= 12 × 42 = 21 unit2

question:
Identify the segment in the sentence which contains grammatical error. Mark ‘no error’ in case the sentence given is correct.
I was laying down when the doorbell rang.
solution:
(b) laying down
Incorrect word is used in part b. Replace ‘laying’ by ‘lying’. Lay means to to put or set down. Lying means in a horizontal position, like lying on bed,grass etc.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.
Pacify
solution:
(a) Soothe - to comfort somebody.
Pacify- to make somebody who is angry or upset be calm or quiet.
Strengthen- to make something or someone stronger.
Blame- responsibility for something bad.
Rebuke- to speak angrily to somebody.

question:
Parts of the following sentence have been underlined and given as options. Select the option that contains an error.
Policeman came to my village and asked about a person who burgled a house last night.
solution:
(a) policeman
Article ‘a’ must be used before the noun ‘policeman’ as it is singular and begins with a consonant sound. Hence, ‘A policeman’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate idiom that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.
Even after becoming bankrupt, Charlie is able to maintain an outward show.
solution:
(d) Keep up appearance- maintain an outward show.
E.g.- Even though he was worried, he kept up appearances and smiled.

question:
Select the option that expresses the following sentence in active voice.
I am not interested in this assignment.
solution:
(d) This assignment does not interest me.(Correct)
(a) This assignment has not interested me. (Meaning of sentence changed)
(b) This assignment is not interesting me. (Incorrect Tense structure)
(c) This assignment did not interest me. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the option that expresses the following sentence in active voice.
Tara’s painting was stolen from the museum.
option_1: Someone stole Tara’s painting from the museum.
option_2: Someone has stolen Tara’s painting from the museum.
option_3: Someone from the museum stole Tara’s painting.
option_4: Tara’s painting has been stolen from the museum.
solution:
(a) Someone stole Tara’s painting from the museum. (Correct)
(b) Someone has stolen Tara’s painting from the museum. (Incorrect Tense)
(c) Someone from the museum stole Tara’s painting. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)
(d) Tara’s painting has been stolen from the museum. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
A. In the middle of a lake they built their capital city.
B. In what is now Mexico there was an older Civilization and some 700 years ago they organized themselves into an Empire.
C. They also grew fine cotton and wove beautiful clothes and had plentiful gold to make jewellery.
D. They had developed a rich agriculture growing corn, Chilly pepper, avocado, and other fruits.
solution:
(a) BDCA
Sentence B will be the starting line as it contains the main subject of the parajumble i.e.Older Civilization. And, Sentence D states about their agriculture growing. So, D will follow B. Further, Sentence C states that they made clothes and jewellery and Sentence A states where their capital city was. So, A will follow C. Going through the options, option (a) has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the word which means the same as the group of words given.
A person difficult to please
solution:
(a) Fastidious
Fastidious - A person difficult to please.
Callous - showing or having an insensitive and cruel disregard for others.
Sadist - a person who derives pleasure, especially sexual gratification, from inflicting pain or humiliation on others.
Ferocious - savagely fierce, cruel, or violent.

question:
Underlined word in the sentence is not spelt correctly. Identify the correct spelling from the options given below.
Raman had been living a reklusive life since he had lost his job.
solution:
(d) Reclusive
‘Reclusive’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
For the unity of the country discipline among the people is called__________
solution:
(b) for
‘Called for’ means required or demanded. The given sentence states that discipline among the people is called for (required) for the unity of the country. Hence, ‘for’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the sentence that uses the given idiom correctly.
Skating on thin ice
option_1: He was on thin ice after making a controversial statement.
option_2: They were on thin ice due to the icy conditions on the road.
option_3: They were on thin ice when they skated on the frozen lake.
option_4: She was on thin ice while trying to balance on a tightrope.
solution:
(a) He was on thin ice after making a controversial statement.
Skating on thin ice - doing something risky which may have serious consequences.

question:
Choose the best alternative which best expresses the meaning of the idiom/ phrase given below as underlined in the sentence.
Despite the highs and lows, life tends to average itself out.
solution: (a) balance itself

question:
Select the word which means the same as the group of words given.
A society or company provides these convenient features
solution:
(c) Amenities- a society or company provides these convenient features.
Equipment- the set of necessary tools.
Facilitate- to make something possible or easier.
System- a set of things working together as parts of a mechanism or an interconnecting network.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.
The government is planning to abolish child care leave for female employees.
solution:
(d) Establish- to begin something.
Abolish- to end a law or system officially.
Ensure- to make something certain to happen.
Eradicate- to get rid of something completely.
Encourage- to give support, confidence, or motivation to someone.

question:
Find a word that is the synonym of-
LUXURIANT
solution:
(d) Abundant.
Luxuriant- rich and profuse in growth; lush.
Abundant- existing in very large quantities.
Luxury-loving- fond of luxury or self-indulgence luxurious tastes luxurious feeling.
Lovely- beautiful or attractive

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
(A) Even their livelihood and their patterns of social interaction greatly depended on the climatic factors.
(B) So the kind of food they ate or the clothes they wore, were all determined by the physical and climatic conditions of the desert.
(C) People living in a desert environment were unable to practise settled agriculture
(D) Settled agriculture was possible in the plains, near rivers and so on but not in a desert.
solution:
(c) CDBA
Sentence C will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. “people living in a desert environment”. Sentence D states that settled agriculture was possible in the plains, near rivers and so on but not in a desert . So, D will follow C. Further, Sentence B states that the kind of food they ate or the clothes they wore, were all determined by the physical and climatic conditions of the desert and Sentence A states that their livelihood and their patterns of social interaction also depended on climatic factors . So, A will follow B. Going through the options, option (c) CDBA has the correct sequence.

question: Pick a word opposite in meaning to Desecration
solution:
(a) Consecration - to make or declare sacred.
Desecration - to damage or show no respect towards something holy or very much respected.
Discouragement - a loss of confidence or enthusiasm.
Despondency - low spirits from loss of hope or courage; dejection.
Expectation - a strong belief that something will happen or be the case.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
Very carefully I ______ the tree I have referred to, and avoiding contact with the creepers, the upper _______ and leaves of which might have been visible from where the tiger was lying, I climbed to the fork, where I had a comfortable seat and perfect _________.
solution:
(d) The words written in option d will perfectly fit in the blanks according to the grammatical context of the sentence.
Stalk - to follow someone
Concealment - hide
Tendrils - a long thin part that grows from a climbing plant

question:
Identify the best way to improve the underlined part of the given sentence. If there is no improvement required, select ‘no improvement’.
The affection of her husband carried her up in the midst of all her problems.
solution: (b) ‘Bore up’ means to help one to endure or persevere through emotional distress. The given sentence states that the affection of her husband helped her to endure the emotional distress in the midst of all her problems. Hence, ‘bore her up’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate homonyms from the given alternatives to fill in the blanks.
He ________ imitate the playful movement of the ________.
Alternatives:
A.does (female deer)
B.does
C.dose
solution:
(b) does, does(female deer)
‘Does’ is the helping verb of simple present tense and ‘does’ is the plural form of female deer. The given sentence states that he does imitate the playful movement of the does. Hence, option (b) is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test
“My new machine is so (96) ______ that it will even suck out ground-in dust and dirt (97) _____________ this". As he spoke, the salesman used his (98)____________ to press the soot and dust into the carpet. The old lady (99)_________ again, but without (100)_________ success as the young man had quickly gone out of the front door.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no. 96
solution:
(d) effective
‘Effective’ means successfully producing the result that you want. The given passage talks about an effective machine. Hence, ‘effective’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test :
“My new machine is so (96) ______ that it will even suck out ground-in dust and dirt (97) _____________ this". As he spoke, the salesman used his (98)____________ to press the soot and dust into the carpet. The old lady (99)_________ again, but without (100)_________ success as the young man had quickly gone out of the front door.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.97
solution:
(a) like
‘Like’ means something similar to somebody/something. The given passage states that the machine can even suck out ground-in dust and dirt like this. Hence, ‘like’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test :
“My new machine is so (96) ______ that it will even suck out ground-in dust and dirt (97) _____________ this". As he spoke, the salesman used his (98)____________ to press the soot and dust into the carpet. The old lady (99)_________ again, but without (100)_________ success as the young man had quickly gone out of the front door.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.98
solution:
(a) heel
‘Heel’ means the back part of your foot. The given passage states that the salesman used the back part of his foot to press the soot and dust into the carpet. Hence, ‘heel’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test :
“My new machine is so (96) ______ that it will even suck out ground-in dust and dirt (97) _____________ this". As he spoke, the salesman used his (98)____________ to press the soot and dust into the carpet. The old lady (99)_________ again, but without (100)_________ success as the young man had quickly gone out of the front door.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.99
solution:
(c) tried
‘Try’ means to do, use or test something in order to see how good or successful it is. The given passage states that the old lady tested the machine again. Hence, ‘tried’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze test :
“My new machine is so (96) ______ that it will even suck out ground-in dust and dirt (97) _____________ this". As he spoke, the salesman used his (98)____________ to press the soot and dust into the carpet. The old lady (99)_________ again, but without (100)_________ success as the young man had quickly gone out of the front door.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.100
solution:
(a) much
‘Much’ is used with uncountable nouns, mainly in negative sentences and questions. The given passage states that the old lady tested the machine again but without(negative sense) much success. Hence, ‘much’ is the most appropriate answer.
